trans-unit.source: Working with ATA Detection Settings | Microsoft ATA
trans-unit.target: Working with ATA Detection Settings | Microsoft ATA

trans-unit.source: Describes how to configure a list of IP addresses and subnets that have unusual circumstances and that should be handle differently than other entities on your network
trans-unit.target: Describes how to configure a list of IP addresses and subnets that have unusual circumstances and that should be handle differently than other entities on your network

trans-unit.source: Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7
trans-unit.target: Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7

trans-unit.source: Working with ATA Detection Settings
trans-unit.target: Working with ATA Detection Settings

trans-unit.source: The **Detection** configuration page lets you set a list of IP addresses and subnets that have unusual circumstances and should be handled slightly differently than other entities on your network.
trans-unit.target: The **Detection** configuration page lets you set a list of IP addresses and subnets that have unusual circumstances and should be handled slightly differently than other entities on your network.

trans-unit.source: Setting up detection
trans-unit.target: Setting up detection

trans-unit.source: In the **Detection** section you can define the following items:
trans-unit.target: In the **Detection** section you can define the following items:

trans-unit.source: **Honeytoken account SIDs** – This is a user account that should have no network activities.
trans-unit.target: **Honeytoken account SIDs** – This is a user account that should have no network activities.

trans-unit.source: This account will be configured as the ATA Honeytoken user.
trans-unit.target: This account will be configured as the ATA Honeytoken user.

trans-unit.source: If someone attempts to use this user account ATA will create a suspicious activity and is an indication of malicious activity.
trans-unit.target: If someone attempts to use this user account ATA will create a suspicious activity and is an indication of malicious activity.

trans-unit.source: To configure the Honeytoken user you will need the SID of the user account, not the user name.
trans-unit.target: To configure the Honeytoken user you will need the SID of the user account, not the user name.

trans-unit.source: You can find the SID of the user on the *Account Info* tab of the user's profile in the ATA console.
trans-unit.target: You can find the SID of the user on the *Account Info* tab of the user's profile in the ATA console.

trans-unit.source: ATA detection settings honeytoken
trans-unit.target: ATA detection settings honeytoken

trans-unit.source: **Detection Exclusions** - You can exclude IP addresses from the following detections.
trans-unit.target: **Detection Exclusions** - You can exclude IP addresses from the following detections.

trans-unit.source: If you enter an IP address in one of these lists, ATA will exclude that IP address from this specific type of detected activity.
trans-unit.target: If you enter an IP address in one of these lists, ATA will exclude that IP address from this specific type of detected activity.

trans-unit.source: DNS Reconnaissance IP address exclusions
trans-unit.target: DNS Reconnaissance IP address exclusions

trans-unit.source: Pass-the-Ticket IP address exclusions
trans-unit.target: Pass-the-Ticket IP address exclusions

trans-unit.source: ATA detection settings exclusions
trans-unit.target: ATA detection settings exclusions
